class Solution:
    def countOfPairs(self, nums: List[int]) -> int:
        if len(nums) == 1:
            return nums[0]+1
        max_num = max(nums)
        valid_nums_1 = [0 for _ in range(max_num+1)]
        valid_nums_2 = [0 for _ in range(max_num+1)]

        for i in range(nums[-1]+1):
            valid_nums_1[i] += 1
            valid_nums_2[i] += 1

        for i in list(range(len(nums)-1))[::-1]:
            # print(valid_nums_1)
            # print(valid_nums_2)
            # print('-----')
            next_v1 = [0 for _ in range(max_num+1)]
            next_v2 = [0 for _ in range(max_num+1)]
            for val in range(nums[i]+1):
                possible_suffixes_1 = sum(valid_nums_1[val:])
                val_2 = nums[i]-val
                possible_suffixes_2 = sum(valid_nums_2[:val_2+1])
                next_v1[val] = min(possible_suffixes_1, possible_suffixes_2)
                next_v2[val_2] = min(possible_suffixes_1, possible_suffixes_2)
            valid_nums_1 = next_v1
            valid_nums_2 = next_v2
        
        return (sum(valid_nums_1)) % (10**9+7)

        
        # print(valid_nums_1)
        # print(valid_nums_2)
        # return -1
